definitions.text: a spontaneous loss of consciousness caused by insufficient blood to the brain
pass out from weakness, physical or emotional distress due to a loss of blood supply to the brain
deficient in magnitude; barely perceptible; lacking clarity or brightness or loudness etc
examples: the wan sun cast faint shadows
the faint light of a distant candle
a dim figure in the distance
saw a vague outline of a building through the fog
a few wispy memories of childhood

definitions.text: weak and likely to lose consciousness
examples: suddenly felt faint from the pain
was sick and faint from hunger

definitions.text: indistinctly understood or felt or perceived
examples: a faint clue to the origin of the mystery

definitions.text: lacking conviction or boldness or courage
examples: faint heart ne'er won fair lady
